posts._title: Pierre Kast & Chris Marker – La Brûlure de mille soleils AKA The Heat of a Thousand Suns (1965)
posts.title: La Brûlure de mille soleils
posts.excerpt: This ultimate masterpiece is set in the far future where a young man, bored by his surroundings, blasts off into space with only his cat and some robots for company. On a distant planet he discovers a serene, tranquil culture and falls in love with a girl. The story follows his problems adjusting to their …

posts._title: Satyajit Ray – Parash Pathar aka The Philosopher’s Stone (1958)
posts.title: Parash Pathar
posts.excerpt: Parash Pathar was Satyajit Ray’s immediate follow-up to his celebrated Aparajito. The film bears the heavy (but never oppressive) influence of Ray’s idol, French filmmaker Jean Renoir. Tulsi Chakravetry plays Parresh Dutt, an elderly clerk who comes into possession of a stone that can turn the humblest mineral into gold. Attaining vast wealth overnight, Dutt …

posts.title: Hairpin Circus
posts.excerpt: A retired racing champion, now a driving instructor, gets involved with the speed tribes after impulsively taking to the streets to relive his former glory.

posts._title: Helmut Käutner – Unter den Brücken AKA Under the Bridges (1946) (HD)
posts.title: Unter den Brücken
posts.excerpt: Two barge skippers fall in love with the same woman. “Under the Bridges”, made in the last year of the Third Reich, proves that artistic genius can flourish even under the most difficult circumstances. posts.title: Blue Velvet (1986)
posts.excerpt: The discovery of a severed human ear found in a field leads a young man on an investigation related to a beautiful, mysterious nightclub singer and a group of psychopathic criminals who have kidnapped her child.
